Authors:
Anna Berthe Ralaiveloarisoa, Kare Liimatainen, Hélène
RALIMANANA, Vololoniaina Jeannoda, Stuart Cable, Tuula Niskanen
Title:
Gloeocantharellus andasibensis sp. nov. (Gomphaceae) from
Madagascar
Keywords:
Fungi, Gomphales, morphology, gloeoplerous hyphae,
ITS
Abstract:
Gloeocantharellus andasibensis sp. nov. is the first
record of the genus from Madagascar. It can be recognized by having
orange red basidiomata, innately fibrillose, viscid pileus, ellipsoid to
amygdaliform, verrucose basidiospores, and a distinct nrITS sequence. To
improve the understanding of the nomenclature of the genus, the specimen
of G. lateritius, G. cornerii and the type specimen of G. okapaensis
accessioned in the fungarium of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew were also
sequenced.
